Assembly Bill A416 was introduced during: 2022 New York State legislative session, but it has not been passed into law by the state legislature.
The bill does not specifically target CO: 19 and does not refer to the establishment of "detention camps." Instead, it allows for the removal of individuals who are potentially dangerous to public health and their placement in isolation centers.
The Centers for Disease Control and Prev: CDC) defines isolation centers as places for individuals who cannot safely isolate at home, and they are not designated as "detention camps" as claimed on social media.
The bill: s requirements, locations, and logistical details for isolation centers are not outlined, and previous bills with similar language have not been successful in passing.
